bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ignacio Alvare, August 14, 1940

div1.p: Hench requests the negative of Alvare's photograph of Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ignacio Alvare, August 14, 1940
div1.opener:
Copy to Moran - could he help get flor
otherwise my out photographs to copy
Photo in Sanidad office (Marinao)
August 14, 1940
Dr. Ignacio Alvare
9, Street #304
Vedado, Havana
Cuba
My dear Doctor Alvare:
div1.p:
I cannot tell you how much I appreciated your letter to me of
July 18, telling me what you know about the building which was pointed out
to you an the site of Camp Lazear. Do you still have the film from which
this photograph was taken? The secretary of Dr. Ramos finally gave me
a copy of the picture that Dr. Recio presented to Dr. Ramos, but in copying
it, the picture lost much of its clarity. If you have the original film
and would send it to me, I would appreciate it greatly if I could make
some prints from it, or if you do not wish to trust the film to the mail,
I would appreciate it if you would have a half dozen prints made, and
I will pay for them.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
